alert.note: Alert for City of Radford; Montgomery; Pulaski (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 10:28PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Radford, Montgomery and Pulaski. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Carper Branch, Connellys Run, Calhoun Run, Meadow Creek, Indian Run, Crab Creek, Goose Creek, Flatwoods Branch, Elliott Creek, Georges Run, Back Creek and Little River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blacksburg... Christiansburg... Radford... Pulaski... Dublin... Walton... Fairlawn... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
